titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Margaret Haley Storms was a poet and author. She graduated from Bryn Mawr in 1928. She lived in Caracas, Venezuala. In 1927 she was nominated for the Glascock Prize as part of an invitation-only poetry competition sponsored by the Mount Holyoke College.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of typed manuscripts of writings by Margaret Haley Storms. Included are three unpublished novels, written in the late 1920s and 1930s, and one volume of photocopies of poems, written between 1926 and 1978, most of them never published.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
